bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 92 (Tuesday, May 28, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WILLIAMS of New York:H.R. 8579.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto Section 8 of Article I of the U.S. Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to directthe Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency tocarry out further improvement of Onondaga Lake, New York, andfor the purposes of integrating research, education, planningand restoration of the watershed.[Page H3534]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

bill.title: Onondaga Lake Watershed Improvement Act

item.title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to direct the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to carry out further improvement of Onondaga Lake, New York, and for the purposes of integrating research, education, planning and restoration of the watershed.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
